data.text:
A storybook proposal - except for one thing...

Over 12 million girls under the age of 18 are married each year. Join @UNICEF's efforts to #EndChildMarriage: https://t.co/1aAV0itcQO #ValentinesDay 

 https://t.co/Eh4atFQQN9
Starting soon: @UN_PGA & @ladealba to brief #UNGA on Climate Action Summit in September 2019. Watch live: https://t.co/WhwXXmCYWf https://t.co/3EXlyjoTvq
#LoveIsLove: On Thursday's #ValentinesDay, join @free_equal & support fair treatment of lesbian, gay, bi, trans & intersex people everywhere. https://t.co/nVI4zJt1It https://t.co/jc8SMyjS6t

UN Peacekeepers leave their families behind and travel to some of the most hostile environments on the planet to help others. More on the brave men & women #ServingForPeace: https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ https://t.co/8unbCHMF4k

Allowing young girls to choose who they marry, and when, empowers them in all aspects of their lives. See what happens when young girls say "#IDONT" to child marriage. https://t.co/a8FWAmquLR #ValentinesDay https://t.co/iakUnj71lK
Thursday's @IFAD Governing Council to feature special address from His Holiness @Pontifex. Details: https://t.co/gtenZyONqZ  #IFADgc https://t.co/Mty0k6ZRiR
.@CIJ_ICJ issues judgement on case involving frozen Iranian assets in the United States:  https://t.co/EdvweyAvFC https://t.co/GE2k2NgcWW

Globally, 1 in 5 girls is married off before turning 18, robbing them of the ability to determine their own future. 

On Thursday's #ValentinesDay, @unfpa is helping girls around the 🌍 say #IDONT to child marriage. https://t.co/zrJ4pa0a91 https://t.co/7J5nQE0Fma
@RadioPakistan Thanks for sharing the message. Happy #WorldRadioDay!

Despite progress in reducing unemployment globally, millions of people are still forced to accept poor working conditions, says new @ILO World Employment & Social Outlook report: https://t.co/QC84of5jDC #DecentWork https://t.co/G77Bvf8tGL
Thanks @Elyyxyak for helping us celebrate radio's role in achieving a more peaceful & tolerant world on Wednesday's #WorldRadioDay!   https://t.co/2OGnhyccf9 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/goYeVp6do4

After 14 days & 500 kilometers, @theflipflopi - a sailboat made of 10 tonnes of recycled plastic, including 30,000 recycled flip flops - completed its #ClimateAction journey in support of @UNEnvironment's #CleanSeas campaign. https://t.co/h2nAguSsEf

"On this #WorldRadioDay, let us recognize the power of radio to promote dialogue, tolerance and peace." -- @antonioguterres on the strength of radio to unite. https://t.co/k3ZuOzRYrL #GlobalGoals https://t.co/i0w6GS5zDy

An estimated 50% of out-of-school children of primary school age live in conflict-affected areas. The #GlobalGoals aim to achieve quality education for all. https://t.co/4LPaezguyW https://t.co/W5e54Gk64y

Just a few of the ways radio benefits people & societies around the world: 

✅ promotes dialogue & understanding
✅ builds sense of community
✅ allows exchange of views & solutions

More on Wednesday's #WorldRadioDay ➡️ https://t.co/XXRQ3ivTJn https://t.co/4a8hNUiYqH

📸: The Japanese Peace Bell at UNHQ in NYC during Tuesday's #SnowDay. 

No matter the weather, the work of the UN continues around the 🌏 for everyone, everywhere: https://t.co/MGT7G5uPFL https://t.co/hgBPkpPenB

Radio broadens horizons and builds more harmonious societies. 

Find out more about how radio unites and empowers people around the world on Wednesday's #WorldRadioDay: https://t.co/XXRQ3ivTJn https://t.co/uYHIRXSKdw

New @WHO and @ITU #SafeListening standard aims to prevent hearing loss among 1.1 billion young people at risk due to excessive exposure to loud sounds, including music.
Protect your hearing, listen safely. https://t.co/5JaloTVi8a

https://t.co/r3kxB5lYu4

Check out the Palais des Nations as you've never seen it before - through the eyes of one of @UNGeneva's specially-trained K9 detection dogs 🐕. https://t.co/CHAmtHjSMx

 https://t.co/UO6TH3cW6t
ISIL remains global threat, despite fewer attacks in 2018 & transformation into largely covert network, according to latest UN report on the terrorist group. https://t.co/EvTsl41MPK

From world leaders to teenage girl coders and a refugee children's choir, experience the #AUSummit with @antonioguterres in our latest @Instagram story ➡️ https://t.co/9e8MShdkPH https://t.co/POWKoIf5eH
On Tuesday's Int'l Day against Child Soldiers, see how @unicef and @unmissmedia are helping to free former child soldiers in South Sudan. https://t.co/hG5vYn4X1Y #ChildrenNotSoldiers

Unsafe food is a threat to human health and economies globally. 

Experts are gathering in Addis Ababa for the 1st International #FoodSafety Conference, starting Tuesday: https://t.co/zHJzJWmhy3 https://t.co/L5kKxasY6q

"Africa has shown enormous generosity & solidarity" – @antonioguterres speaking to #BBCNewsday's @kasujja at #AUSummit on support to refugees, migrants & internally displaced persons across the continent https://t.co/qsiR0FVmNZ https://t.co/AuxZF8129a

“Don't let anyone tell you that math & science is not for you" -- these leaders in science have an important message about why opening doors for girls & #WomenInScience benefits all ⬇️ #GlobalGoals https://t.co/VMj6JRUkRK

Epilepsy affects more than 50 million people worldwide - making it one of the most common neurological diseases globally. More on Monday's World #EpilepsyDay: https://t.co/CF1CZbxRqA https://t.co/9oMhvsFugn

Social inclusion is critical to end inequalities & discrimination. Starting Monday at #CSocD57, gov't reps & experts from around the world look for solutions for a better life for all. https://t.co/8plAcr0Gdq #GlobalGoals https://t.co/VZOywu2FeR

“African countries provide nearly 1/2 @UNPeacekeeping troops worldwide, including 2/3s of women peacekeepers & the majority of UN Police. Their service & sacrifice are always at the forefront of our minds.” 
@AntonioGuterres at #AUSummit https://t.co/LSaxP9j6zj #ServingforPeace https://t.co/cZlSixXlMx

.#WomenInScience still face significant implicit bias on the basis of their gender. Meet 6 women tech sheroes who inspire us all to break down #STEM stereotypes: https://t.co/lzlejQcOZq #GlobalGoals https://t.co/RutcZnrWbY
What's happening this week at the UN? Commission for Social Development #CSocD57, #WorldRadioDay & much more >> https://t.co/28eSBlzspk https://t.co/RAGt2Ucxbr

More diversity = more innovation 
When women can fully contribute their ideas & perspectives, science can work better for everyone.
Monday is girls & #WomenInScience Day! 
https://t.co/aNVKFKx8eH v @UNESCO #GlobalGoals https://t.co/VBye1RJQDe

Did you know...the International Court of Justice -- or "world court" -- was established in 1945 to settle legal disputes between countries. Since then, 176 cases have been submitted to the Court: https://t.co/BHgiltoawl https://t.co/0NDRPbS3rf
The world needs science, and science needs women. Join @UN_Women on Monday's #WomenInScience Day and spread the word! https://t.co/O11dRz3fNI #GlobalGoals https://t.co/a6fRoddyG9

"If you want to see winds of hope blowing, look at Africa." 

See more highlights of @AntonioGuterres's visit to the #AUSummit here:  https://t.co/yOI94pb3Bv https://t.co/OWgkcRjI6n

200 million girls & women alive today have undergone some form of female genital mutilation. A new @UNFPA exhibit helps visitors to UNHQ in NYC get to know the faces & stories behind efforts to #EndFGM: https://t.co/2qnhYLLveL https://t.co/gdsLNtEzRm

Visiting NYC? Take a special #BlackHistoryMonth themed tour at UNHQ, featuring the "Ark of Return" slavery memorial & more. @VisitUN details here: 
https://t.co/Nqo1kZ8N5f https://t.co/LobkGbQr7u

Pulses are one of nature's most nutritious foods. On Sunday's #WorldPulsesDay, see 10 reasons why pulses should be a staple of every healthy diet: https://t.co/7JcCsqnrr4 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Mp6ToEfklk

“Africa’s generosity to those seeking havens from war and persecution is unmatched” – @AntonioGuterres at #AUSummit. 

See what else he said here: https://t.co/lmekQqihBz https://t.co/vm9tMCqMWC
Live at #AUSummit: @AntonioGuterres gets a round of applause when says, “Unfortunately,  generosity is not proportional to wealth” https://t.co/2Cdmx2wVRN https://t.co/wuBmXCQ1r2
This week, @unmissmedia reported a dramatic drop in political violence in South Sudan since signing of peace agreement. https://t.co/tmXCztyeTP

African leaders at the #AUSummit in Addis Ababa are discussing durable solutions to the challenges related to forced displacement, peace & security, #globalgoals & more. 

Here is what @AntonioGuterres is hearing from them: https://t.co/VijuX0ueY4 https://t.co/6H5faEO3IU
Pulses are more than just nutritious seeds, they contribute to the #GlobalGoals and a #ZeroHunger world. Sunday is #WorldPulsesDay: https://t.co/jC8yscCNrY https://t.co/bIzhE66d8U

“We need to find solutions that work for both people & planet,” -- @AlecBaldwin & wife @hilariabaldwin were at the UN this week to show their support for the #GlobalGoals! https://t.co/uADy8t3aif https://t.co/unKaqOpSmN
What exactly is a "pulse" - and why are they important for health and achieving #ZeroHunger? Find out on Sunday's #WorldPulsesDay: https://t.co/jC8yscUoQy https://t.co/uP5LCgggDC
Despite "entrenched imbalance", greater international cooperation could help turn the tide against rising inequality, says @UNCTAD globalization expert. https://t.co/CpII52VZ71

These teens showed @AntonioGuterres their coding skills. They are taking part in a @UNWomenAfrica & @ITU programme to bridge the #digitaldivide & to work for #globalgoals https://t.co/4ozHbUKyZi https://t.co/bNHxs5ue7u

#AUSummit: @AntonioGuterres is in AddisAbaba to talk about durable solutions to challenges related to forced displacement, peace & security issues, #globalgoals, human rights, & much more https://t.co/HJXS8AjPoF https://t.co/6mDCQq5DNR
“It is important that nobody is forced back" -- UN @RefugeesChief calls for greater support for 330,000 refugees being hosted in Tanzania. https://t.co/yFLUBbJP5x #WithRefugees

“How can we know if people are starving or not? Just stand at the border with Colombia and look at who is coming in" -- @WFP update on humanitarian situation in Venezuela. https://t.co/hBlyW5xMaB https://t.co/uf5sOPLwOL

Mine Action news: last week @UNMAS demolished a 100kg air-dropped bomb in South Sudan, marking its one millionth destruction of explosive items in the world’s youngest nation. Details from @UNMISSmedia: https://t.co/D4FByqRshi https://t.co/1DEBUM4yhP

📸: A Darfuri cultural group performs a traditional dance at a recent @unamidnews-organized event in Swellenga village, North Darfur, to promote peaceful coexistence: https://t.co/YAkK3DXNva #ServingForPeace https://t.co/gLfNnGsJED
#AUSummit events are underway in Addis Ababa & @AntonioGuterres will arrive soon. For more UN updates, follow @ECA_OFFICIAL & @SongweVera and see: https://t.co/jFEYcBG1wz https://t.co/VPEjpJ0iSw
#FBF to February 1949 when UNHQ in NYC was under construction. Shown here is the @UNLibrary - an integral part of the UN's work: https://t.co/FQYPEaOQod https://t.co/mQqfWFmCUA
Ahead of next week's #WomenInScience Day, discover some of the main hurdles women & girls face in STEM, and what can be done to level the playing field. https://t.co/xkLSEIw6Cj

Lives are being saved around world through landmine clearance - but new contamination is putting even more people at risk says @UNMAS Mine Action Portfolio 2019: https://t.co/72cIFK4s6M https://t.co/oiIUCBOFCW

#CleanSeas news: after 14 days & 500 kilometers, @theflipflopi boat made of re-used plastic & flip flops has reached its final destination: Zanzibar. 
@UNEnvironment shares the inspiring story of innovation to tackle plastic pollution. https://t.co/SbaBF8tLwl

Measles infection rates highest in a decade across Europe, with 72 deaths across region in 2018. @WHO_Europe says progress in raising immunization rates insufficient ➡️ https://t.co/25nIZxtT1g #VaccinesWork https://t.co/sDmvYZllUl

Syria: Largest ever humanitarian convoy brings life-saving aid to 40,000 displaced people in Rukban. @UNinSyria is working with partners to deliver aid to those struggling to survive in dire conditions amid harsh weather. https://t.co/9PmGtw6iId https://t.co/U5kod0Nra8

📸: Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, President of Equatorial Guinea, tours the "Ark of Return" slavery memorial at UNHQ. The country holds the Security Council Presidency for February: https://t.co/EpdYfKkc36 https://t.co/vuOFpt2bWR

With 48 different #IndigenousLanguages, Peru is one of the most linguistically diverse countries in the Americas. @PNUDperu explores the preservation of languages & identities in a digital world: https://t.co/ttdJt7Fqrx #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/20iTJX5ywc

📸: Students in Madagascar jubilantly head to the school canteen where @WFP provides daily fortified hot meals. WFP runs school feeding programmes in 71 countries, serving 18.3 million children. https://t.co/uztC1xxNNE #ZeroHunger https://t.co/nYWSMmitfN
.@antonioguterres urges parties to “live up to their commitments” as Central African Republic Government signs off on peace deal with over a dozen armed groups. https://t.co/RRqcaFyMDK
Ahead of trip to @_AfricanUnion Summit in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, @antonioguterres expresses optimism, says "wind of hope" is sweeping across Africa:   https://t.co/wdl3lHGj76

The past 4 years have been the 4 warmest years on record - and the warmest 20 years on record have been in the last 22 years. @WMO's latest global climate report ➡️ https://t.co/VTf2FsujYl #ClimateAction https://t.co/GegTE8SPuR

Benjamin Orenstein survived the Holocaust. Listen to his story of loss, fear and survival: https://t.co/AGgDjErrsN via @UNHumanRights #StandUp4HumanRights
https://t.co/aKPs313WIq

There's no medical or religious justification for female genital mutilation (FGM) yet 200 million girls & women alive today have undergone some form of the procedure. See how one girl stood up & had her voice heard to #EndFGM. https://t.co/1s4YuzCsDV https://t.co/RL2LSz2FjE
With help from @FAO, farmers in the Philippines are using drones to improve their livelihoods & achieve #ZeroHunger. https://t.co/gwU0Gqdkgk https://t.co/r5gSKnzOWu
Female genital mutilation is a human rights violation. @UNFPA calls for legislation to #EndFGM & ensure a better future for millions of young girls. https://t.co/7cJUn717HP https://t.co/VEfc7X0ztr

Children are among the most vulnerable to flu. Now, kids are teaming up with @WHO and using their drawing skills to spread the word about staying flu-free https://t.co/pzAdUvBOQN https://t.co/MBZFmFICED

Survivors of female genital mutilation are speaking out - and using their personal stories to protect other women & girls from this devastating practice. Tuesday is #endFGM Day. https://t.co/0Pht1lILGO
UN launches massive humanitarian appeal for Libya $200M+ needed to provide urgent life-saving support for more than half a million people in the country. https://t.co/eHVx7JexLJ
200 million girls and women alive today have undergone some form of female genital mutilation. More from @UNFPA on Wednesday's #EndFGM Day: https://t.co/7cJUn7iIzn https://t.co/oGC1tCSX6f
Resettlement in another country is a life-saving option available for only the most vulnerable refugees in the world. https://t.co/TvleUFbkIH via @refugees https://t.co/9guE5tXwZt
With trade wars making news, who is feeling the pain and who - if anyone - is seeing gains? A new @UNCTAD study tries to answer that question: https://t.co/8MxcyuwSuD https://t.co/xtRE5lwM5D

35,000 people are seeking shelter in Cameroon after fleeing repeated attacks by Boko Haram fighters in Nigeria. The UN & partners are on the ground providing life-saving aid: https://t.co/KEyh4jOh6J https://t.co/2VQsqdrEnT

A kind message 💬
A smile 😀
A like 👍

This #SaferInternetDay, take the time to be kind online and make a big difference to someone’s day. 

#ENDviolence online. https://t.co/r1P0t9vwAF https://t.co/cmSmyc5twk

Social protection prevents poverty, reduces inequality and improves health & education. 

Yet 1 billion+ children are not effectively covered under any social protection system. 

More from @ILO: https://t.co/0l4AbQhAK7 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/QeCSeokydM

On Tuesday's #SaferInternetDay, young people share what it’s like to grow up online - the good and the bad. 

#ENDviolence online. https://t.co/r1P0t9N7sd via @UNICEF https://t.co/zXs0XrFFFu
Good news for our planet: @GCF_News and @WorldBank partnership unlocks USD 2.7 billion to advance #ClimateAction in 10 countries: https://t.co/PnAt1GtpGB https://t.co/Flm7gtKoel

Reducing risk factors & early diagnosis are 🗝️ to beating cancer.

Find out more on Monday's #WorldCancerDay: https://t.co/IzmgkCJfzs #GlobalGoals https://t.co/uutQuAPWeG

UNHCR Special Envoy Angelina Jolie is in Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh to assess the humanitarian needs of the nearly 1 million Rohingya refugees from Myanmar & the challenges facing their host country: https://t.co/ZqNG5Kyk2K via @refugees https://t.co/rhFBFGfGlF

It's World Interfaith Harmony Week -- an opportunity for mutual respect and understanding. Here's how @UNAOC works to bridge divides all year round: https://t.co/19eWUETRXb #GlobalGoals https://t.co/VjrXE9STsN
Nearly 1/3 of all cancers are preventable. On Monday's #WorldCancerDay, see what you can do to reduce your cancer risk. https://t.co/IzmgkCJfzs #GlobalGoals https://t.co/eXEvFoARyt
Starts Monday @UN_Vienna: International Narcotics Control Board, 124th session (through 8 Feb): https://t.co/HFyJOblaM6 https://t.co/S00QDTfBd8
Continues this week @UNGeneva: Conference on Disarmament (through 29 March). Details: https://t.co/wxkB1OMAbb https://t.co/JXhpCevcEK
What's happening this week at the UN? #EndFGM Day, @antonioguterres at #AUSummit & much more: https://t.co/28eSBlzspk https://t.co/hOOv1qdEis
With 33% more instances of cancer expected by 2030, @iaeaorg explains how nuclear science & tech is key to better cancer treatments. #WorldCancerDay https://t.co/KRShrqfHKd https://t.co/Ns3IwN6S8o

Many cancer cases are diagnosed too late when they are harder to treat successfully. Early detection saves lives. More from @WHO on Monday's #WorldCancerDay: https://t.co/U35fVozyNH https://t.co/hFEeFVb1YD

Can your  #ClimateAction idea change the 🌍? 

@unenvironment is looking for young people to step up & invent the future.  Apply here to become one of the 2019 #YoungChamps: https://t.co/iZjJJbvceA https://t.co/ZOdAFihyLO
Climate change is a race we can win. Go to https://t.co/zTkumwgS40 and join people around the 🌎 in taking collective #ClimateAction. https://t.co/biwzmVVBWE

The @UNPeacekeeping mission in Cyprus is the 1st to have 3 women in charge of its military, police & civilian staff. Find out more in our latest @instagram story: https://t.co/UH4OQC7zhU https://t.co/bMh55tid0D

Important milestone: one millionth explosive item demolished in South Sudan. @UNMAS works to reduce human suffering that continues long after the fighting stops. https://t.co/D4FByqRshi via @unmissmedia https://t.co/iSE55n6UYu

Welcome to the UN family @NomzamoMbatha!

The newest @Refugees Goodwill Ambassador will help amplify the voices of those forced to flee. https://t.co/pLp83fx5CP

This week @UNESCO launched the Year of #IndigenousLanguages. 

Here are 10 facts about these languages threatened with extinction - and the people that speak them. https://t.co/b5Pe7M0gTG via @UNDP #WeAreIndigenous
This week we honoured the 10 brave UN Peacekeepers from Chad who gave their lives while protecting others and #ServingForPeace in northern Mali.  https://t.co/2Lv0CpQ7IC
Know a young artist? Deadline for this year's @CITES #WorldWildlifeDay contest is coming soon. Info here: https://t.co/bKPgR8kduC https://t.co/1gvdudB64r
Meet the friendly groundhog who made a home by the “Arrival” sculpture on the grounds of UNHQ in NYC. https://t.co/Rk16zJONjo #GroundhogDay https://t.co/W5uovmSRty
